steps.title: Launch site (all tests)
details: App loads at / and feature pages (/add, /transfer).
1 visual UI check failed on most landings: small buttons / low-contrast text.

steps.title: PWA installation flow
details: Waited for browser’s install prompt – never appeared.

steps.title: Theme / UI-customisation flow
details: Dark-mode toggle could not be located; colour-theme & glow steps skipped.

steps.title: Data import / export flow
details: ‘Select JSON file’ button repeatedly intercepted by overlaying label – click never lands.

steps.title: Task sharing flow
details: Homepage loads; ‘Add Task’ button visually present but unstable – click never fires.
Unable to create/select task → share steps skipped.

steps.title: Task creation flow (running)
details: Form opens; multiple passes selecting emoji/colour.
Validation state not surfaced; later steps (deadline, category, submit) still pending.
Several UI checks flag inconsistent typography, padding, button styling.

steps.title: Task completion & progress tracking flow
details: User adds ‘Test Task’, marks it done, sees progress bar & badge update.
Minor visual issues noted (spacing, progress-bar clarity).

emotional_arc: Initial curiosity ⇒ mild concern (small / low-contrast UI). Rapid frustration when key features (install prompt, dark mode toggle, file-upload, Add-Task click) fail. Confidence briefly recovers during successful task-completion flow, but overall impression ends mixed-negative: app feels unreliable and visually unpolished.

qualitative_opportunities.area: Critical controls not found or unclickable (install prompt, dark-mode toggle, Add-Task, JSON upload)
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Blocks users from core functions; leads to abandonment.
next_actions: Verify elements are rendered and in DOM on all viewports.
Remove overlapping labels/divs that intercept clicks.
Increase click target sizes & stability (avoid animations on mount).
Provide fallback in-app buttons when browser PWA prompt is absent.

qualitative_opportunities.area: Visual hierarchy & readability (colour contrast, typography, button size)
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Poor legibility and unclear hierarchy reduce usability and perceived quality, especially accessibility.
next_actions: Audit colour palette against WCAG AA; adjust foreground/background contrast.
Standardise font sizes, weights, heading styles via design tokens.
Adopt consistent button component with adequate padding/min width.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Inconsistent padding/margins make interface feel cluttered and unprofessional.
next_actions: Set global spacing scale and apply via reusable CSS classes.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Users submitting forms need immediate, clear guidance when fields are missing.
next_actions: Ensure required fields surface inline error messages and disable submit until valid.
Add toast/snackbar confirmations for actions like import/export/share.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Accurate status builds trust; current progress bar/badge occasionally out of sync.
next_actions: Recalculate progress after state change; add unit tests.
Make progress bar and badge visually prominent and contrast-compliant.

first_tackles.description: Fix click-blocking overlays for ‘Select JSON File’ & ‘Add Task’ buttons (CSS pointer-events / z-index).
Surface dark-mode toggle & ensure it is discoverable (header or settings modal).
Increase text/background contrast to meet WCAG AA across app (quick stylesheet tweak).
Add in-app PWA install button as fallback when browser prompt fails.
Standardise button/label typography and spacing using a shared component library.
